image.altText: Calvary Hospital in Canberra

items.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court halts Calvary Health Care's bid to stop the ACT government from taking over Calvary Public Hospital.

title.children: ACT Supreme Court dismisses Calvary Health Care's bid to stop government's hospital takeover

image.altText: ACT court precinct

items.synopsis: A court hears 43-year-old Michael O'Connell's former partner Danielle Jordan suffered catastrophic head injuries when she allegedly fell from the bonnet of his car.

title.children: Jury retires to decide whether Canberra man murdered 'love of his life', who allegedly fell from car bonnet

image.altText: A computer keyboard lit up in red.

items.synopsis: Russian-linked cybercriminals claim to have gone through with a threat to publish troves of sensitive data, after one of Australia’s largest law firms vowed not to bend to their ransom demands.

title.children: 'ENJOY!!': Hackers claim to go through with dark web threat after law firm refuses ransom

image.altText: Ajinkya Rahane slashes the ball away

items.synopsis: Australia will be looking to take India's five remaining wickets quickly to establish a big first innings lead on day three of the ICC World Test Championship Final at The Oval. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Rahane frustrates Australia on day three of WTC Final

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Scott Boland has done it again! KS Bharat took guard, a deep breath and prepared for his first ball of the day. Turns out that's the extent of his involvement. It was another Boland beauty, nibbling at the right hander from a perfect length. It found the gap between bat and pad and shattered middle and off. It's trademark Boland, and it's a big early breakthrough for Australia. India on the ropes already.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: BOWLED HIM! Boland strikes second ball of the day!

children.content: Scott Boland has done it again! KS Bharat took guard, a deep breath and prepared for his first ball of the day. Turns out that's the extent of his involvement.

It was another Boland beauty, nibbling at the right hander from a perfect length. It found the gap between bat and pad and shattered middle and off. It's trademark Boland, and it's a big early breakthrough for Australia.

image.altText: Two Ukrainian soldiers, one with a rocket launcher, walk through a sunlight clearing in the woods.

items.synopsis: As both sides report heavy fighting along the frontlines, Kyiv claims it has intercepted a phone call that shows Russian saboteurs were behind the dam attack, while the Kremlin says flood victims have been killed by shelling.

title.children: Russia reports heavy fighting in southern Ukraine, Kyiv silent on counterattack

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue top.

items.synopsis: The Australian National Audit Office this week found the grant, presented in-person by former Prime Minister Scott Morrison in 2019, was likely unlawful and lacked due diligence.

title.children: Lucy was planning to speak out about Perth's Esther Foundation, then Scott Morrison gave it $4m

image.altText: The logos of the four big banks in Australia

items.synopsis: Here's a breakdown of which major banks have responded to the RBA's June rate rise decision, and which ones we're still waiting on.

title.children: Which banks are changing their interest rates after the RBA made its 12th increase?

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump in shadow with his fist raised in the air.

items.synopsis: For the second time this year, former US president Donald Trump has been indicted on criminal charges. So, what happens now? Here's everything we know.

title.children: Trump's second indictment of the year may not be his last. This is what we know about his legal woes

image.altText: An older man lying in a hospital bed looks off to the left, resting his hand behind his head.

items.synopsis: As Russia continues its campaign in Ukraine, estimates place the number of civilian casualties in the thousands. But beyond the facts and figures are real lives changed forever by the war.

title.children: Former Soviet colonel Dmytro was out and about getting some exercise. Then he woke up in a pool of blood

image.altText: a young boy smiling at the camera while in a pool wearing a silver chain around his neck

items.synopsis: Balin Stewart died after being stabbed once in the heart by the teenager during a physical altercation outside his Buddina home in January last year.

title.children: Teenager who stabbed 16-year-old boy to death outside his Sunshine Coast home found guilty of manslaughter

image.altText: Truck tipping recyclable items at recycling plant

items.synopsis: Federal, state and territory environment ministers have provided the first details about what the new regulations will mean for manufacturers.

title.children: The packaging industry will be forced to follow new waste rules following failure of voluntary targets

image.altText: dry terrain in outback new south wales

items.synopsis: Days after the Bureau of Meteorology issued a warning that an El Niño weather event could happen, its US equivalent has raised the stakes.

title.children: US weather agency declares first El Niño in eight years is already underway

image.altText: A man and a woman speaking

items.synopsis: Former detective chief inspector Pamela Young speaks for the first time after her work on the death of US mathematician Scott Johnson more than 30 years ago was examined by the NSW inquiry into LGBTIQ hate crimes.

title.children: 'Taken out of context': Detective responds to claims she was hostile towards Scott Johnson family

image.altText: A composite photo of two men and a young woman

items.synopsis: The Victorian Supreme Court has heard a full account of the night the Newborough man ingested GHB at gunpoint in remote bushland in the state's east in 2020.

title.children: Jarrad Lovison's father calls son's killers Jake Brown and Andrew Price 'sinister dogs' at pre-sentencing hearing

image.altText: A tall full-forward for Port Adelaide yells in triumph as he celebrates a goal while a defender stands by.

items.synopsis: The Power are on track for a 10th straight win, but their lack of accuracy with goalkicking gives the Bulldogs a sniff at Docklands. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Power lead at Docklands but poor kicking could cost them

image.altText: A Manly NRL player passes to his left as he is tackled by a Dolphins opponent.

items.synopsis: The Sea Eagles and Dolphins battle for a top-eight spot, while Raiders stalwart Jarrod Croker's 300th NRL match ends in defeat, as the Warriors triumph 36-14 in Canberra. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRL live: Sea Eagles clash with Dolphins after Warriors beat Raiders to crash Croker's party

image.altText: Michael McConnaughty standing against a brown panel wall.

items.synopsis: A 27-year-old Perth man faces court after being charged with sexually assaulting three women he met through online dating apps.

title.children: Perth man accused of raping women he met on dating sites granted bail, as court hears there could be more victims

image.altText: A young woman pictured with someone else whose faced is blurred

items.synopsis: Mayumi Spencer's husband wanted the coronial findings about his wife's death suppressed, but media outlets successfully fought to make them public.

title.children: Victorian coroner finds Mayumi Spencer, 29, died of a cocaine overdose, but also can't rule out manslaughter

image.altText: woman wearing a white singlet in empty room with timber pieces

items.synopsis: A North Lismore couple who have accepted a property buyback say a lack of detail on where new land will be developed is forcing their hand to leave the area.

title.children: Kirsty took a buyback after her house flooded. She didn't realise it would push her out of town

image.altText: Two older gentleman are photographed looking into the camera in a stadium

items.synopsis: Trailblazing Socceroos coach Rale Rasic is being remembered as a man who changed the face of football in Australia, after his death aged 87.

title.children: First coach to lead Socceroos to a World Cup remembered as a 'giant' of the game

image.altText: A man with a goatee beard, brown hair and glasses wearing a polo shirt.

items.synopsis: Each year, dozens of people claim to have been injured by police, but only a handful of officers end up facing court for those alleged assaults. In South Australia, police have been accused of charging their alleged victims instead, to stop their allegations being properly investigated.

title.children: Nathan suffered serious injuries at a police station — they charged him with assault

image.altText: Brittany wears a black blazer and walks from the courthouse with David, who wears a suit. They look serious.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese insists Finance Minister Katy Gallagher did not mislead parliament and has rejected suggestions that Labor coordinated to politically benefit from former Liberal staffer Brittany Higgins's allegation as "nonsense".

title.children: Anthony Albanese rejects claims of Labor coordination over Higgins's allegation

image.altText: Bottles of wine

items.synopsis: A winemaker says he has a heavy heart about his business's latest step after it buckled under the pressure of natural disasters, COVID restrictions and trade tariffs.

title.children: Decades-old winemaker pushed into voluntary administration

image.altText: An adult and baby rhinoceros at a zoo

items.synopsis: Taronga Zoo is acting to address $2.6 million in "historic underpayments" to 902 current and former casual staff at both their Sydney and Dubbo zoos.

title.children: $2.6 million owed to casual workers at two of NSW's biggest zoos

image.altText: A side view of a man wearing sunglasses and a blue suit

items.synopsis: Mark Sebo stands accused of stealing more than $1 million from the superannuation accounts of eight clients and spending it on online gambling.

title.children: Trial begins for financial adviser accused of stealing more than $1 million from clients' superannuation funds

image.altText: a close-up of a woman's pregnant belly. she has one hand underneath her belly and one on top of it

items.synopsis: The tenants, who are of Kenyan origin, accused the husband-and-wife owners of the building of a campaign against them that included racial discrimination, surveillance, obstructing access and "humiliating and offensive" language.

title.children: 'The child once born, is not authorised': Couple wins racial discrimination case against landlord

image.altText: Two men drink champagne while standing at an office window.

items.synopsis: Sixty-six people earned more than $14 million in the 2020-21 financial year, but new data from the Australian Taxation Office shows they paid zero income tax.

title.children: 66 people earned an average of $14.5 million in 2020-21. None of them paid a cent in tax to the ATO

image.altText: Anne Hollonds sits in an office. A glass table and a bookshelf are in the background

items.synopsis: Children's Commissioner Anne Hollonds believes too few young people across Australia have access to early intervention and diversion initiatives like Hoops 4 Health.

title.children: Children's Commissioner undertakes major inquiry into youth justice system in 'crisis'

image.altText: Port1

items.synopsis: It has been almost 20 years since the Power won a flag, but a clever investment in the 2018 draft has put the club in its best position yet to rectify that, writes Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson.

title.children: The power to rule — why this Port trio is the best high-end draft haul in 18 years

image.altText: An unidentified pregnant woman

items.synopsis: The state's maternity system has been under pressure due to staff shortages and recruitment difficulties but the health minister says a $42 million funding injection will reduce the need for pregnant women to travel.

title.children: More flying obstetricians promised to help rural Queensland women give birth near home

image.altText: A medium close-up shot of ABC managing director David Anderson speaking into a microphone in a radio studio.

items.synopsis: ABC managing director David Anderson flags an acceleration of the transition to digital and away from broadcast, as he releases details of the organisation's five-year plan.

title.children: ABC radio services set to be consolidated in five-year plan, as audience moves to digital

image.altText: Former prime minister Bob Hawke receives a bark painting from Galarrwuy Yunupingu in 1988.

items.synopsis: The Barunga Festival gets underway, marking 35 years since Indigenous leaders presented the Barunga Statement to former prime minister Bob Hawke. So, what's changed since then?

title.children: It's 35 years since Bob Hawke was presented with the Barunga Statement. What's changed?
